intro: Toddalia willdenowii, commonly known as the yellow sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of fleshy, waxy leaves that help it retain moisture in arid conditions. Its showy yellow flowers bloom in summer and are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Toddalia willdenowii is often found in sandy or disturbed soils and is adapted to coastal and inland dunes.
